InstructionData.Title: DataLogger Slave
InstructionData.Author: Hijel
InstructionData.Instructions: #Slave Data Logger Code to be used with the Stationeers Data Logger Windows App #Found at: https://github.com/HijelHub/Stationeers_Data_Logger #------------------------------------------------------------------------ #If you have more than one Slave DataLogger, you have to connect them in series. #Slave2 would alias Slave1 and Slave1 would alias Master DataLogger. #If you try and connect them all to the master datalogger, they will lose sync. #and you will lose data. alias DataLoggerMaster d0 #Master Datalogger... needed to get timing and iteration count alias ProcessHousing d1 #Where your variables are coming from #alias IC10HousingName2 d2 #alias IC10HousingName3 d3 #alias IC10HousingName4 d4 #alias IC10HousingName5 d5 # Don't forget to set the values on the housing with a screwdriver! #------------------------------------------------------------------------ #Setup the Iteration counter alias IterationCounter r15 alias LastIterationCounter r14 move IterationCounter -1 move LastIterationCounter 0 #------------------------------------------------------------------------ # *** EDIT! - The following defines need to be set correctly on all logger housings *** #Change the LoggingInerval to the same value as your main datalogger define LoggingInterval 0.5 #Seconds #Change the VariableCount to the number of variables you want to log on each event define VariableCount 2 #------------------------------------------------------------------------ SLAVELOGGER.RUN: beqal IterationCounter -1 SLAVELOGGER.CLEAR #clear stack if called for by Master l IterationCounter DataLoggerMaster Setting #get iteration from main datalogger bneal LastIterationCounter IterationCounter SLAVELOGGER.LOG #if theres a change log data yield j SLAVELOGGER.RUN SLAVELOGGER.LOG: #make sure there is room in the stack for this logging packet add r13 VariableCount 1 add r12 sp r13 brlt r12 511 2 move sp 0 #------------------------------------------------------------------------ #*** EDIT! THIS PORTION TO REFLECT THE STACK VARIABLES YOU WANT TO GET *** get r0 ProcessHousing 0 get r1 ProcessHousing 1 #etc... # Write the iteration counter and variables to the stack (the "packet") push IterationCounter push r0 push r1 #etc... #------------------------------------------------------------------------ # setup the iteration counters for the next loop move LastIterationCounter IterationCounter s db Setting IterationCounter #display iteration on housing for next Slave Logger j ra SLAVELOGGER.CLEAR: #Clear this housings stack memory when commanded locally or remotely with a -1 reading clr db move sp 0 j ra
